page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The area has a loamy soil over clay, ideally suited to intensive cultivation of grass which supports cattle for milk, beef and sheep. Compound fertilisers used with top dressings of nitrogen to boost summer growth as well as organic manure produced on the farm. Grass conserved for winter use in the form of hay (one crop ) & silage (two or three crops), increasingly in big bales. Fields relatively small (3 - 25 acres) fenced with hawthorn hedges. Dairy cattle mostly Friesian, grazed outside April to October and housed in cubicles for the winter. Calving in the autumn is most popular and herd replacements are reared on the farm. Beef cattle come from the dairy herd crossed with Hereford or Charollais. Sheep ( Mules and Mashams ) are reared for meat & wool.
